intro: Orchis matodes, commonly known as the purple marsh orchid, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetlands and moist meadows in Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking purple-pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces a single spike of flowers with a distinct, spurred lip. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, adapted to thrive in damp environments. Orchis matodes plays an important role in supporting pollinators and maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
